msgSnippet: Brian, Try using the -noloading switch: java junit.swingui.TestRunner -noloading -- Erik Meade             emeade@objectmentor.com Senior Consultant

Brian,

Try using the -noloading switch:

java junit.swingui.TestRunner -noloading

--
Erik Meade             emeade@...
Senior Consultant      Object Mentor, Inc.
http://www.junit.org 
 

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Brian K. Buckley [mailto:bbuckley@...]
> Sent: Monday, May 14, 2001 9:27 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] junit.textui.TestRunner vs junit.swingui.TestRunner 
> 
> 
> Hi,
> 
> When I run junit.textui.TestRunner, everything works fine.
> 
> When I run junit.swingui.TestRunner instead, I get the exception 
> trace shown below.
> 
> What's wrong? How can I get the swing version to work?
> 
> Thanks,
> 
> - Brian
> 
>
